title: Dynamic Radial Menu System
description: Create a professional Radial Menu system in minutes with minimal Blueprinting knowledge required!
longDescription: Video: youtube.com/watch?v=WlMk2OrZQag All the work has been done, there will be minimal adjustment to get it to work with the game you are working on, but after that - - it is an entirely streamlined process with a huge and diverse way of customizing your individual menu. Once you've adapted the menu system to your project, it takes mere minutes to set up a whole series of menus. There are two types of menus to work with: redirection menus, and executable menus. With these different menus, it is quite easy to define whether a menu is going to open a new menu, or perform an action. And each menu can also be given a parent menu, so if you wish to go back to a prior menu, it is a simple task. If no parent menu is given, then it will automatically close the menus.
technicalDetails:
Built-In support for Keyboard/Mouse/Controller

Menu Types:
	• Redirect Menu
	• Execution Menu

(1380 Characters) Countless combinations to customize menu:
	• Menu Scale
	• Menu Transparency
	• Menu Hole Size
		- Menu items adjust according to hole size
	• 3 Menu Types
		- Pie Menu - Menu is static, cursor rotates
		- Roulette Menu - Indicators static, Menu rotates
		- Radial Menu - Each component is in a box
	• Use of Top Text
		- Top Text is Static, or mimics highlighted object
		- Top text Color & Shadow Text Color dependent on highlighted item, or static
	• Use of Center Text
		- Center Text is Static, or mimics highlighted object
		- Center Text Color & Shadow Text Color dependent on highlighted item, or static
	• Use of Center indicator
		- Center Indicator texture
		- Center indicator offset
	• Use of Outer indicator
		- Outer Indicator texture
	• Customization for Individual Component Piece for Each Array item in the Menu
		- Menu Color (1 color for whole menu, or each menu individually colored)
		- Use of Main Text
			*Main Text duplicates Array Names
			*Color Main Text/Shadow for the whole menu, or for each individual component
		- Use of Icon
			*Choose the icon for each individual component
		- Use of SubText
			*SubText Fully customizable
			*Color SubText/Shadow for the whole menu, or for each individual component
Minimal amount of work after setup
Changing Menus is extremely simple
